result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Valadez

records.addlTxt: Defendant not in court. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Maynard requesting to withdraw as counsel. Must file motion. Judgment on BFH. Minutes filed.
Bond set 4-12-22 and forfeited 5-16-22

2:28PM - (64-06) Defendant Martin Valadez not in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeramiah Maynard in court for Martin Valadez.
Interpreter Bruce Goodman in court, sworn by clerk.
Attorney Maynard has had issues contacting defendant. Does not have a valid phone number. Attorney Maynard is requesting two (2) weeks to contact defendant.
ADA Herrmann objects for reasons stated on the record and is requesting Warrant to issue and Bond Forfeited.

Court will issue a Warrant for Martin Valadez arrest and Forfeits Bond.

2:28PM - (64-06) Defendant Martin Valadez not in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeramiah Maynard in court for Martin Valadez.
Interpreter Bruce Goodman in court, sworn by clerk.
Attorney Maynard has had issues contacting defendant. Does not have a valid phone number. Attorney Maynard is requesting two (2) weeks to contact defendant.
ADA Herrmann objects for reasons stated on the record and is requesting Warrant to issue and Bond Forfeited.

Court will issue a Warrant for Martin Valadez arrest and Forfeits Bond.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Martin Valadez in court. Attorney Tony Kim appeared. Waiver of Time Limits for Preliminary hearing. Minutes filed.

Defendant Martin Valadez appeared by video, in custody. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 2:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF209 and adjourned initial appearances on other files - 22CF197, 22CF198, and 21CM284. Record by Atty. Kim that he was under the impression that the defendant would be hiring private counsel. Response by the DE. Atty. Kim asks that all matter be put on Monday at 1:15 so he can go over new complaint with the defendant and determine how to move forward. Current date for preliminary hearing remains on at this time. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22CF197, 22CF198 & 21CM284


Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.L.N. OR RESIDENCE NO CONTACT WITH M.H. (dob 11/18/1995). Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing. Bond set 3/28/22 ordered forfeited.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing. Bond set 3/28/22 ordered forfeited.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Martin Valadez in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Leah Selmek appeared for Attorney Tony Kim in court for Martin Valadez. Previous bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Martin Valadez in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant believes he has SPD representation. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Martin Valadez in court with Attorney Tony Kim. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Bond set over the weekend. State asking for one more week to make charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.L.N. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
